column4: i tried fsck but it didnt work. i also tried e2fsck -b 8193 <device> but it regularly says the same message
i tried fsck but it didnt work. i also tried e2fsck -b 8193 <device> but it regularly says the same message
an I/O error may indicate a failing drive.  In a terminal type "dmesg" and see if your kernel is see lots of I/O errors.  Best of luck, and i agree with Dr_Willis backup statement above.
